SceneText.FriendlyName: Capital City Balka - Apartment Building 2nd Floor

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ・集合住宅二階
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka - Apartment Building 2nd Floor

Entry.JapaneseText: 集合住宅二階
Entry.EnglishText: Apartment Building 2nd Floor

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王様のお披露目があると 思うと眠れません。
Entry.EnglishText: I haven't been able to sleep because I can't stop thinking about the inauguration ceremony.

Entry.JapaneseText: ほら、目が真っ赤でしょ？ ……近頃寝不足で……
Entry.EnglishText: Can't you see how red my eyes are? I'm so sleep deprived...

Entry.JapaneseText: もうすぐ儀式が始まるわ。 私もそろそろ出かけなくちゃ…… でも、まだ仕度が……
Entry.EnglishText: The ceremony is going to start soon. I need to get ready... But I'm so tired...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマは品がないわね…… まったく……
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma have no manners... For crying out loud...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、上のガジュマが うるさいんですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma that lives above me has been so loud lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: まったく…… ガジュマと来たら……
Entry.EnglishText: Seriously, those Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが近づくだけで どうしようもなくイラつくの！ とっとと出てお行き！
Entry.EnglishText: Just having a Gajuma nearby irritates me! Get out!

Entry.JapaneseText: よく考えたら、女王様も ガジュマなのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: I've been thinking about how the Queen is a Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうして、あんなに儀式が 楽しみだったのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder why I was so excited for the ceremony...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが近づくだけで どうしようもなくイラつくの！ とっとと出てお行き！
Entry.EnglishText: Just having a Gajuma nearby irritates me! Get out!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてこの国の偉い人は みんなガジュマなんだろうね？
Entry.EnglishText: Why are all the important figures in this country Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: どうにもガジュマばっかり ひいきされてるみたいで 不愉快だわ……！
Entry.EnglishText: I feel like Gajuma are the most priveleged in this nation... How reprehensible!

Entry.JapaneseText: あらあら、キレイなお嬢さん、 私に何か用？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, what does a pretty girl like you need from me?

Entry.JapaneseText: 薬なら、街外れの商店に 売ってるはずよ。 汽車で行けばすぐよ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're looking for medicine, there's a store on the outskirts of the city that sells some. You can get there using the train.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>ゴルドバの日<White>の頃から 今日までイロイロあったわ…… そしてわかったの。
Entry.EnglishText: A lot has happened since the <Blue>Day of Goldba<White>, and I've come to realize something.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの本音も、やり口も！ もう昔のように共存なんて ウソでも言いたくないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: Now I know how you Gajuma truly feel and what you're scheming! We need to stop peddling the lie of coexistence!

Entry.JapaneseText: 引っ越そうと思ってるの。 上の階はガジュマでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm thinking of moving out. You know how a Gajuma lives upstairs?

Entry.JapaneseText: 踏みつけられてるみたいで、 気分が悪くって……
Entry.EnglishText: I feel like I'm always being stepped on... I can't live like this...

Entry.JapaneseText: この音……何かしら。 まるで上の階のガジュマの 足音みたいで耳障りね！
Entry.EnglishText: Just what is this noise...? It almost sounds like the Gajuma upstairs stomping around! I can't stand it!

Entry.JapaneseText: 上の階のガジュマの足音が うるさいのかと思ったら 違ったみたいなの……
Entry.EnglishText: I was thinking the Gajuma upstairs was stomping her feet too loud, but I was mistaken...

Entry.JapaneseText: 一体、何の音なのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: Just what in the world is this noise...?

Entry.JapaneseText: この大変な時に何よ!? どさくさに紛れて、 ドロボーしようなんて 許さないわよ！
Entry.EnglishText: What are you doing here at a time like this?! I'm not going to let you rob me!

Entry.JapaneseText: 上の階のガジュマの足音が 止まったのかと思ったら 震えて縮こまってたの……
Entry.EnglishText: I thought I heard the Gajuma upstair's footsteps come to a stop, but it looks like it's because they're cowering in fear...

Entry.JapaneseText: ふん、いい気味だわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph, serves her right...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ここは集合住宅なの。 上に住む人の物音が少し気になるけど、 他の人と住むには我慢が肝心ね。
Entry.EnglishText: This is an apartment building. The noise from the people living above me bothers me somewhat, but you have to be patient when living with others.

Entry.JapaneseText: それになんと、家賃が 一ヶ月で２５０００ガルド！ どう、あなたも住んでみない？
Entry.EnglishText: Besides, the rent is only 25,000 Gald a month! Why don't you give the apartment life a try?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『里親募集してます』 ワンちゃんの赤ちゃんの里親に なってくれる方を探してます。 とても珍しい体毛の子もいます。 詳しくは大家まで。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Looking for Dog Fosters - We're looking for people willing to foster some puppies. Some of them have rare coat colorations. Please contact the landlord for more details.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『引き出しの中身』（下段） なかなか品のいい服が入っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Drawer's Contents - (Bottom Drawer) There's some rather classy clothing stored in here.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『引き出しの中身』（上段） ヘソクリは入ってない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Drawer's Contents - (Top Drawer) There's no money hidden inside.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『引き出しの上のもの』 犬狼王ヤージ（ぬいぐるみ）。 第三十二代ヤージ王が狩りに出かけた時、 獲物がいないといけないからと、 部下が狼を用意しておいた。 それを知ったヤージ王はその狼を連れて 帰り、家族として大いに可愛がった。 さらに「小動物憐れみの令」まで発令した。 その後、ヤージ王の名前を付けた狼の ぬいぐるみが世の中で大流行した。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Item on Drawers - It's a Wolf King Yaaji plush doll. One time when the thirty-second King, Yaaji, was out hunting, his subordinates prepared a wolf for him in the event he would find no prey. When King Yaaji learned of this, he instead brought the wolf home and cared for it as a member of his family. He even issued an edict calling for compassion towards small animals. Since then, stuffed wolf toys named after King Yaaji became very popular.
